Scope and Contents Note
This collection consists of material donated by Pamela Schafler, chair of the New-York Historical Society's Board of Trustees. It includes two pieces of correspondence from Jacqueline Kennedy, a photograph of President John F. Kennedy, a photograph of President Lyndon Johnson and family, and an envelope from the White House postmarked 1964. In addition, there are two telephotographs (photographs transmitted via telegraph, a process also know as phototelegraphy) from the 1930s. The telephotographs are stamped "This telephotograph was transmitted over wires of the Bell System."
